{{also|Bis|bis-|biş|biś|bís|Biś}} ==English== ===Etymology 1=== ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|en|/baɪz/}} ====Noun==== {{head|en|noun form}} # {{inflection of|en|bi||p}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{der|en|la|bis||twice}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|en|/bɪs/}} ====Adverb==== {{en-adv|-}} # [[twice|Twice]]; showing that something is, or is to be, repeated, such as a passage of music, or an item in accounts. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=bis|BSI|IBS|IBs|SIB|sib}} ---- ==Albanian== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|sq|la|bis||twice; again!}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|sq|/bis/}} ===Noun=== {{sq-noun}} # [[encore]] (brief extra performance after the main performance is complete) {{tbot entry|Albanian|encore|2010|March|sq}} ===Interjection=== {{head|sq|interjection}} # {{non-gloss definition|used to request an encore}} ---- ==Cimbrian== ===Noun=== {{cim-noun|f}} # {{l|en|meadow}}, {{l|en|lawn}} ====Derived terms==== * {{lb|cim|diminutive}} {{l|cim|bisle}} ===References=== * Umberto Patuzzi, ed., (2013) [http://www.lusern.it/documenti/Centro_documentazione/libri-depliant-att--didattica-relazioni-etc-/libri/le-nostre-parole-luserna.pdf Ünsarne Börtar], Luserna: Comitato unitario delle linguistiche storiche germaniche in Italia / Einheitskomitee der historischen deutschen Sprachinseln in Italien [[Category:cim:Nature]] ---- ==Danish== ===Noun=== {{head|da|noun form|g=c}} # {{inflection of|da|bi||gen|s|indef}} ---- ==Esperanto== ===Etymology=== From {{der|eo|la|bis}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|eo|/bis/}} ===Interjection=== {{eo-intj}} # [[encore]]! ---- ==Fiji Hindi== ===Etymology=== From {{der|hif|hi|बीस}}. ===Numeral=== {{head|hif|numeral}} # {{cln|hif|cardinal numbers}} [[twenty]] ---- ==French== ===Etymology 1=== ====Pronunciation==== * {{fr-IPA}} ====Noun==== {{head|fr|noun plural form|g=m-p|g2=f-p}} # {{inflection of|fr|bi||p}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{der|fr|la|bysseus||cotton-coloured}}; cf. Italian {{m|it|bigio}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{fr-IPA}} ====Adjective==== {{fr-adj}} # [[beige]] {{qualifier|colour}} # [[brown]] {{qualifier|of bread that contains bran}} ===Etymology 3=== From {{der|fr|la|bis||twice}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{qualifier|adverb}} {{fr-IPA|bisse}} ====Adverb==== {{fr-adv}} # [[again]] (a second time); [[encore]] # {{lb|fr|in street numbering or law}} [[a]]; designating a second thing with the same number. #: {{ux|fr|12 '''bis''', rue des Carmelites|12A, rue des Carmelites | inline = 1 }} ====Adjective==== {{fr-adj|inv=1}} # [[alternative]], [[secondary]] ====Noun==== {{fr-noun|m|bis}} # [[encore]] ====Interjection==== {{fr-intj}} # {{non-gloss definition|used to request an encore}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|fr|bisser||to ask for an encore; to do an encore}} * {{l|fr|itinéraire bis||detour}} ===Etymology 4=== From {{m|fr|bise}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{fr-IPA}} ====Noun==== {{fr-noun|m|bis}} # {{lb|fr|Quebec}} [[kiss]] ===Further reading=== * {{R:TLFi}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|biz}}, from {{m|gmh|bī}} {{m|gmh|ze}}. Equivalent to modern {{m|de|bei}} and {{m|de|zu}}. Compare {{cog|stq|bit||until}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/bɪs/}} * {{audio|de|De-bis.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-bis.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{homophones|de|Biss}} * {{rhymes|de|ɪs}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction}} # {{lb|de|subordinating|temporal}} [[until]] #: {{ux|de|Wir warten hier, '''bis''' das Gewitter vorbei ist.|We'll wait here '''until''' the thunderstorm is over.}} # {{lb|de|coordinating}} [[to]] #: {{ux|de|Ich arbeite 40 '''bis''' 50 Stunden in der Woche.|I work 40 '''to''' 50 hours a week.}} #: {{ux|de|Ihre Haare sind braun '''bis''' dunkelbraun.|Her hair is brown '''to''' dark brown.}} ===Preposition=== {{head|de|preposition}} # {{lb|de|temporal}} [[until]], [[to]], {{qualifier|US}} [[through]] #: {{ux|de|Meine Tochter ist '''bis''' zwei Uhr in der Schule.|My daughter is at school '''until''' two o'clock.}} #: {{ux|de|Ich war von Montag '''bis''' Freitag krank.|I was sick from Monday '''to''' Friday.}} # {{lb|de|temporal}} [[by]] #: {{ux|de|Die Aufgabe muss '''bis''' Donnerstag fertig sein.|The task must be complete '''by''' Thursday.}} # {{lb|de|local}} [[to]]; all the way to #: {{ux|de|Der Zug fährt '''bis''' Köln.|The train goes '''to''' Cologne.}} ====Usage notes==== * The temporal preposition ''bis'' can be followed by temporal adverbs of all kind: {{m|de||bis nachmittags|until afternoon}}, {{m|de||bis jetzt|until now}}. Moreover it can be followed by times, dates, holidays, days of the week, months, or years. The words {{m|de|Woche||week}}, {{m|de|Monat||month}}, and {{m|de|Jahr||year}}, as well as the names of days and months may also be preceded by {{m|de|letzter}}, {{m|de|voriger}}, {{m|de|dieser}}, {{m|de|kommender}}, or {{m|de|nächster}}. For example: {{m|de||bis letzte Woche|until last week}}; {{m|de||bis nächsten Freitag|by next Friday}}. * The local preposition ''bis'' can be followed by local adverbs of all kind (e.g. {{m|de||bis hier|over here}}) and by place names (see above). * In other cases, ''bis'' must be followed by another preposition, most commonly {{m|de|zu||to}}: {{m|de||bis '''zum''' Sommer|until summer}}; {{m|de||bis '''zum''' ersten Freitag im neuen Jahr|by the first Friday of the new year}}; {{m|de||bis '''zum''' Hauptbahnhof|to the main station}}. This means that ''bis'' is never directly followed by a definite or indefinite article. Sometimes other prepositions may also be used after ''bis'': {{m|de||Er ging bis '''ans''' Ufer.|He went close to the shore}}. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|bis auf}} [[Category:German subordinating conjunctions]] ---- ==Indonesian== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|id|nl|bus}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|id|/bis/}} ===Noun=== {{id-noun}} # [[bus]] ---- ==Italian== ===Etymology=== From {{der|it|la|bis||twice}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|it|/bis/}} ===Noun=== {{head|it|noun|g=m}} # [[encore]] # [[repetition]] # [[duo]] (two varieties as a unit) #:{{ux|it|Un '''bis''' di baccalà|'''Two varieties''' of salt cod }} ===Adjective=== {{head|it|adjective|invariable}} # [[additional]] ---- ==Latin== ===Etymology=== An adverb for {{m|la|duis|'''du'''is}}, from {{m|la|duo||two}}, as {{m|la|b}} is often interchanged with {{m|la|du}} in word-initial position in Latin (in the same way as {{m|la|duellum|'''du'''ellum}} for {{m|la|bellum|'''b'''ellum|war}}, {{m|la|duonus|'''du'''onus}} for {{m|la|bonus|'''b'''onus|good}}, {{m|la|duis|'''du'''is}} for {{m|la|bis|'''b'''is|twice}} etc.) Before that, from {{der|la|ine-pro|*dwís||in two, twice, doubly}}, from {{m|ine-pro|*dwóh₁||two}}; compare {{cog|grc|δίς||dis}}, {{cog|sa|द्विस्|sc=Deva}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{la-IPA|bis}} * {{audio|la|la-cls-bis.ogg|Audio (Classical)}} ===Adverb=== {{la-num-adv|bis|type=freq}} # [[twice]], [[two]] times, on two occasions, in two ways #* {{Q|la|Horace|Odes|3|9|quote=Me torret face mutua / Thurini Calais filius Ornyti, / pro quo '''bis''' patiar mori, / si parcent puero fata superstiti.|trans=I love my own fond lover, / Young Calais, son of Thurian Ornytus: / For him I'd die '''twice''' over, / Would Fate but spare the sweet survivor thus.}} #: {{ux|la|Falli '''bis'''.|t=To be deceived '''twice'''.}} #: {{ux|la|Familia mea '''bis''' in hebdomade ad ecclesiam it.|t=My family goes to the church '''twice''' a week.}} ====Usage notes==== * The word {{m|la|bis||twice}} drops the {{m|la||s}} when making compositions, like the Greek word {{m|grc|δίς||dis}}. Some words created by compositing include {{m|la|biceps}}, {{m|la|bidens}}, {{m|la|bifer}}, {{m|la|bigener}}, {{m|la|bīga}}, {{m|la|bilix}}. Because the {{m|la||s}} is dropped, it's better to write the words like {{m|la|bissenus}}, {{m|la|bisseni}} and {{m|la|bissextus}} as two words- {{m|la|bis senus}}, {{m|la|bis seni}} and {{m|la|bis sextus}}. ====Derived terms==== {{der3|la|{{l|la|bis in die}}, {{l|la|bis die||twice a day}} |{{l|la|bis in mense}}, {{l|la|bis mense||twice a month}} |{{l|la|bis in anno}}, {{l|la|bis anno||twice a year}} |{{l|la|bis terque||several times, repeatedly}} |{{l|la|bis tanto}}, {{l|la|bis tantum||twice as great, twice as much}} |{{l|la|bis ad eundem||to commit the same error twice}} |bis minus |ne bis in idem }} ===References=== * {{R:L&S}} * {{R:Elementary Lewis}} * {{R:Gaffiot}} * {{R:M&A}} * {{R:Smith's Geography}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/bis/}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|lb|conjunction}} # [[until]] (something becomes true) #: {{ux|lb|Mir waarde mam Iessen, '''bis''' datt eis Gäscht all ukomm sinn.|We are waiting with the food '''until''' all our guests have arrived.}} # [[between]] ... [[and]] #: {{ux|lb|Zeideg Quidde moosse 7 '''bis''' 12 Zentimeter laang.|Mature quinces measure '''between''' 7 '''and''' 12 centimetres long.}} ===Preposition=== {{head|lb|preposition}} # [[until]] (a certain time) #: {{ux|lb|D'Metzlerei ass '''bis''' fënnef Auer nomëttes op.|The butcher's is open '''until''' five in the afternoon.}} # [[up to]], [[to]] #: {{ux|lb|Hire Jong ka scho '''bis''' zéng zielen.|Their son can already count '''up to''' ten.}} ---- ==Middle English== ===Etymology=== A version of {{m|enm|bith}} with the third-person singular ending replaced with {{m|enm|-es}} as in other verbs (in some dialects). ===Verb=== {{head|enm|verb form}} # {{alt form|enm|bith}} ---- ==Navajo== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nv|[pɪ̀s]}} ===Noun=== {{head|nv|noun}} # [[adobe]], [[clay]], [[clod]], cake of dirt [[Category:Navajo basic nouns]] ---- ==Polish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{pl-IPA}} ===Noun=== {{pl-noun|m-in}} # [[encore]] ====Declension==== {{pl-decl-noun-m-in}} ---- ==Portuguese== ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|Portugal}} {{IPA|pt|/ˈbiʃ/}} * {{a|Brazil}} {{IPA|pt|/ˈbis/|/ˈbiʃ/}} * {{rhymes|pt|is}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{der|pt|la|bis||twice}}. ====Adverb==== {{pt-adv|-}} # {{l|en|bis}} {{gloss|shows that something is to be repeated}} ====Noun==== {{pt-noun|m|bis}} # {{l|en|encore}} {{gloss|brief extra performance}} # {{lb|pt|by extension|informal}} a second {{l|en|serving}} of something =====Derived terms===== * {{l|pt|bisar}} ====Interjection==== {{pt-interj|!}} # {{l|en|encore}}! {{gloss|used by an audience to request a second performance}} ===Etymology 2=== ====Noun==== {{head|pt|noun form|g=m|g2=f}} # {{inflection of|pt|bi||p}} {{catlangname|pt|terms with multiple etymologies}} ---- ==Swedish== ===Noun=== {{head|sv|noun form}} # {{sv-noun-form-indef-gen|bi}}
